corperation greed and money-thirsty capitalists cancelling a game that won't be able to get them a lot of money.

To be fair, the game was never really given a chance to make money.  Studio changes, high developer attrition, scope creep...all of those things contributed to the project losing (in my best guess) millions before they were even ready for what they called Early Access.

13 hours ago, Alpha_star said:

it's just corperation greed and money-thirsty capitalists cancelling a game that won't be able to get them a lot of money.

That's just basic economics. You won't be in business for a long time if you allow your projects to be draining your money.

The problem wasn't cancelling the project because it was loss giving. The problem was running the project in such a way that there were huge cost overruns with no game to show for. By far not a case of corporate greed prematurely cutting off a game before it could earn its money back; that was a station passed a long, long time ago.
